poem:
Cancelled Melodies

Fuzzy frames of forgotten beats,  
echoes dance in digital streets,  
where Shaun sways with gravity's grace,  
and Cedric's chords time can't erase.  
While screens have hushed the live refrain,  
on pixel tides, the notes remain—  
a melody in fleeting scroll,  
in shadowed clips, the music's soul.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guide #181: TV has given up on live music – but social media won’t let it die Whenever, in a weak moment, I find myself mindlessly scrolling on Instagram, it usually isn’t long before I encounter a compellingly fuzzy video of a band performing on a long-since-cancelled TV show: Shaun Ryder with a bowl cut swaying awkwardly to Happy Mondays’ Step On on a 1990 edition of Top of the Pops; or Cedric and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
